result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
[ma] Case called at 1:51pm [Commissioner Brian Hartley presiding for Branch 3 Intake]
Defendant Chase R Olson appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies date of birth; updates address to: c/o Stephanie Olson at N6795 County Road A, Lot #49, Lake Mills 53551
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within the time limit.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the criminal complaint. 

The Court requires a $3500 CASH Bond with conditions:
--no contact with anyone listed in Victim/Witness Key
--no presence at the residence of anyone listed in Victim/Witness Key

recess 2:06pm

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 11/11/22 at 2:30pm

ADDRESS INFO for Chase R Olson
Current: N6795 County Road A, Lot #49, c/o Stephanie Olson, Lake Mills, WI 53551 United States  (Effective: 11-04-2022)
Prior: homeless, Jefferson, WI 53549
